Timeout of 0 means max timeout of 30 seconds as well. <br><br><template><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> This command will read prepared params set with [[camPrepareFOV]], [[camPreparePos]] and [[camPrepareTarget]], so no [[camCommitPrepared]] is necessary. If [[camPrepareFOV]] is not set, the default value is 1. If [[camPrepareTarget]] (for direction) and [[camPreparePos]] (for position) are not set, current [[direction]] and [[position]] of the camera are used. The prepared camera preload will preload main camera as well. [[cameraEffect]] is not necessary</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> camera: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> timeout: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code> _camera '''camPreload''' 5 </code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Preload camera around player to avoid stuttering on optics zooming: <code>[] [[spawn]] 
{
	_cam = "camera" [[camCreate]] ([[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "camera");
	[[for]] "_i" [[from]] 0 [[to]] 359 [[do]]
	{
		_cam [[setDir]] _i; 
		_cam [[camPrepareFov]] 0.25; 
		_cam [[camPreload]] 0;
		[[waitUntil]] { [[camPreloaded]] _cam };
	};
	[[camDestroy]] _cam;
};</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
